image.altText: 2024-10-03T220058Z_772970726_RC29DAALVLAQ_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-LEBANON

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he has discussed possible Israeli strikes on Iranian oil facilities, with his comments causing a spike in oil prices.

title.children: Israel strikes Beirut again as Dutton calls for Iranian ambassador to be expelled from Australia for praising slain Hezbollah leader

image.altText: A close up photo of a woman wearing a police uniform

props.synopsis: New South Wales Police have brought in a former human rights commissioner to conduct an official review of the culture within the force following an ABC News investigation.

title.children: NSW Police launch review into toxic culture within force following ABC investigation

image.altText: Australia's Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The NACC confirms it conducted a raid on the premises at Parliament House, saying its investigation does not relate to a current or former politician.

title.children: Corruption watchdog conducts raid at Parliament House in relation to 'ongoing investigation'

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: Two women hug

props.synopsis: Fawzia Sido is one of 5,000 members of the Yazidi religious minority, mostly found in Iraq and Syria, who were killed or kidnapped in an IS campaign in 2014 that the UN has said constituted genocide.

title.children: Yazidi woman freed from Gaza in US-led operation after decade in captivity

image.altText: A series of photos of someone in a kitchen, taken from ground level

props.synopsis: Without even entering the building, we were able to silently peer through the camera on a Deebot device made by Chinese giant Ecovacs.

title.children: The world's largest home robotics company has a problem – its vacuum cleaners can be hacked from afar

image.altText: A balcony overlooking water.

props.synopsis: Queensland authorities are probing the fees residents are charged to sell retirement villas, following an ABC investigation into the multi-billion-dollar sector.

title.children: State government to probe retirement village provider's close ties to real estate company

image.altText: Donald Trump does a fist pump.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump likely won't face court again before next month's election but that doesn't mean the wheels aren't still turning on the criminal cases against him.

title.children: Donald Trump and Mike Pence's partnership didn't end well. New court filings allege just how bad it got

image.altText: Blonde woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Psychologist Frances Crawford, 49, was found dead at the bottom of a retaining wall at her property west of Brisbane in the early hours of July 30.

title.children: Police appeal for information about the marriage of ride-on mower murder victim

image.altText: Woman with white hair, black top and ivory blazer looks ahead

props.synopsis: Jurors found Tina Peters guilty in August for allowing a man to misuse a security card to access to the Mesa County election system and for being deceptive about that person's identity.

title.children: Former US state county clerk jailed for 9 years for 2020 presidential race voting data scheme

image.altText: Tech graphic

props.synopsis: Ever received a scam text from Australia Post while you're waiting for a package? Or a fake toll notice after you've driven on a toll road? Experts say data collected by the online advertising industry could be behind it.

title.children: The completely legal trick scammers can exploit to target millions of Australians

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Oil prices have surged amid fears of a broadening conflict in the Middle East, while the ASX 200 remains near record highs. Follow the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Crude oil prices jump amid fears of Israeli strike on Iranian oil facilities, ASX steady near record highs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Housing loans rose in August, boosted by new investors
ASX lower at lunchtime, weighed down by miners and the big four banks
How would rising oil prices impact the global economy?

image.altText: A photo of Mike Reynolds sitting in a black suit and looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: In the days after WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention, the government sacked its corrective services commissioner, Mike Reynolds. Now, for the first time, he details the chaos behind the scenes during his tenure.

title.children: Sacked corrective services boss lifts lid on troubled youth detention system

image.altText: Dental xray illuminated on a light screen.

props.synopsis: A new report shows many Australians are delaying dentist visits or waiting years to receive publicly funded care — and in some parts of the country, wait times are going up.

title.children: Thousands of Australians are hospitalised for potentially preventable dental conditions, report shows

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the teenager, now aged 19, argue extraneous and extensive pre-trial publicity of Ms Lovell's death could prejudice a jury.

title.children: Second teenager accused of murdering Queensland mother Emma Lovell to face judge-only trial

image.altText: A rendering of PsiQuantum's Brisbane quantum computer

props.synopsis: Australia is making a billion-dollar bet on a "useful" quantum computer in the Queensland capital, but surprisingly few experts agree on what the nation will get in return for its investment.

title.children: Australia is bankrolling a $1b quantum computer in Brisbane. Big corporations will use it first

image.altText: Image of a coal mine from above with what appears to be activity

props.synopsis: A coal mining group with former links to a US fraudster denies claims of illegal mining, and destroying koala habitat without federal approval. Environment groups are doubling down, and want immediate action.

title.children: 'This is illegal coal mining': Koala habitat cleared without federal approval by company previously linked to fraudster

image.altText: Flood damaged properties are seen on Federation Drive in the suburb of Bray Park.

props.synopsis: Researchers have found 23,000 Australians over the age of 15 have been displaced by floods, bushfires or cyclones on average every year since 2009.

title.children: This couple is selling up after an unexpected flood, with new research predicting more to be displaced from extreme weather

image.altText: Grindr

props.synopsis: ACT Policing say they have executed five search warrants as they investigate the alleged assaults of three men using an LGBTQ+ dating app in July.

title.children: Police search homes, seize electronic devices after alleged Grindr assaults in Canberra

image.altText: An artist's illustration shows an apartment complex full of activity.

props.synopsis: Artist renderings of public housing built by a proposed government-owned developer have been released by the Greens — as well as their $40 billion price tag.

title.children: The Greens say you could live in this 'beautiful' home, but the scheme would cost taxpayers $40b

image.altText: Aunty Tapua hopes the funding will resolve the water security issues, for the sake of the future of the community.

props.synopsis: The First Nations community of Cherbourg will receive $26 million to upgrade its water infrastructure, after years of substandard supply despite living just three hours' drive from Brisbane.

title.children: Community forced to buy in bottled water hopes new funds will finally fix town's E. coli-riddled supply

image.altText: Woman using an asthma inhaler

props.synopsis: Victorians are being urged to see their GPs and make a management plan as the thunderstorm asthma season begins.

title.children: Victorians are being warned this year's thunderstorm asthma season could be worse than normal

image.altText: A large four-metre crocodile sits on the sand bank.

props.synopsis: An online influencer has come under fire for boasting about feeding a four-metre crocodile in Far North Queensland just a month after penalties for interfering with the reptiles were drastically increased.

title.children: Influencer under investigation over wild croc feeding video

image.altText: A poster with a front-on photo of dolphin and writing in Japanese

props.synopsis: Over recent months, there have been multiple reports of a lone dolphin attacking swimmers. Why is it happening and what are authorities saying?

title.children: Lone dolphin appears to be behind series of 'attacks' on Japanese swimmers

image.altText: Ben Simmons in action for the Brooklyn Nets

props.synopsis: After a nightmare three-year run, Ben Simmons insists he is fit and firing ahead of the upcoming NBA season. Whether he is able to take to the court consistently will determine just how long his future in the game is.

title.children: 'I'm pretty good': Ben Simmons is talking tough, but needs his game to back it up to save his basketball career

image.altText: A tiger with its paws on a wooden bench and greenery behind it

props.synopsis: An official at the Centre of Disease Control said the tigers likely consumed meat from infected poultry.

title.children: Deadly bird flu strain H5N1 kills 47 tigers in Vietnam zoos

image.altText: Pauline David being lifted onto an accessible taxi

props.synopsis: Pauline David had to sleep in her wheelchair after an accessible taxi failed to arrive to take her home. She's one of many people with a disability struggling to maintain independence as the number of accessible cabs in NSW declines.

title.children: Woman forced to sleep in wheelchair at night as number of accessible taxis dwindle

image.altText: Republican presidential nominee and former US President Donald Trump and Melania Trump

props.synopsis: The former first lady signals she is taking a different stance on abortion rights than her husband in a new video and memoir.

title.children: Melania Trump signals support for abortion rights in her new memoir

image.altText: a teenage boy in a white t-shirt eats a sausage on white bread

props.synopsis: Sydney's new young councillors all feel very lucky to have got in at all. But cost of living and negative politics are keeping young people away from running.

title.children: Gen Z who devoured 18 democracy sausages at state election wins council seat five years later

image.altText: A for sale sign out the front of an apartment building.

props.synopsis: We asked three experts for their tips to first home buyers. This is what they said.

title.children: House prices are on the rise but these experts say there's still room for first home buyers

image.altText: NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk sitting in chair being interviewed for TV.

props.synopsis: In an interview with Stateline, NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk says the government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10 will only entrench cycles of disadvantage and increase the number of violent adult criminals in the territory's justice system.

title.children: NT children's commissioner says lowering criminal age to 10 will increase violent offending

image.altText: light skinned man with dark coloured short cut hair, smiling and wearing a black hoody. standing in front of a graffit wall

props.synopsis: Prison newspapers made by and for prisoners have battled censorship and bans. But they've proven that, more than 70 years later, they're not going anywhere.

title.children: Prisoners weren't allowed mainstream media so they came up with another way to connect with the outside world

image.altText: A Pakistan fielder leaps in the air in celebration as a batter looks on at the Women's T20 World Cup.

props.synopsis: The ninth Women's T20 World Cup gets underway in the United Arab Emirates, with wins to Pakistan and Bangladesh in Sharjah.

title.children: Pakistan beats Sri Lanka, Bangladesh beats Scotland as Women's T20 World Cup gets underway

image.altText: Vance and Walz shake hands.

props.synopsis: Time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A Veep off, a Haka record, and the surprising place to find cheap groceries
